Introduction

Kim Kibum, known better as his stage name Key is a member of the South Korean boy group SHINee under SM Entertainment.
He is well known for his love for fashion, he helped design many of SHINee's costumes worn in concerts. He was also in a TV drama called Lookout, where he played one of the main characters Gong Kyungsoo.

He debuted as a member of SHINee on May 22, 2008 with the group's first mini album Replay.

In September 2016, Key made his official acting debut in the tvN drama Drinking Solo which aired from September 5 to October 25.

Key made his solo debut on November 6, 2018 with his first digital single "Forever Yours", which was later featured on his first studio album 'Face'.

On March 4, 2019, he enlisted in the military as a member of the military band. He was officially discharged on October 7, 2020.
